name: Introduction to Computer Science (CS50)
description: Harvardâ€™s legendary CS50 course introducing algorithms, data structures, and programming fundamentals.

name: Algorithms, Part I
description: Learn the essential algorithms and data structures for problem-solving and efficient computing.

name: Operating Systems and You
description: Understand how operating systems work and how to interact with them using Linux.

name: Computer Networks
description: Learn how the Internet works, from IP addressing to routing and data transmission.

name: Introduction to Databases
description: Learn SQL, relational models, and database design with practical examples.

name: Artificial Intelligence Foundations
description: A broad introduction to modern AI, including search, logic, and machine learning basics.

name: Software Engineering Principles
description: Explore software design, testing, maintenance, and agile methodologies.

name: Computer Architecture
description: Understand CPU design, memory hierarchy, and the hardware-software interface.

name: Human-Computer Interaction
description: Study how users interact with technology and how to design user-friendly systems.

name: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
description: Learn about encryption, threats, and secure computing systems.

name: Data Science and Analysis with Python
description: Learn how to use Python, Pandas, and NumPy to analyze data and visualize insights.

name: Deep Learning Specialization
description: Master neural networks, CNNs, RNNs, and advanced AI applications.

name: Computer Graphics
description: Learn the principles of computer graphics, rendering, and 3D transformations.

name: Theory of Computation
description: Dive into automata theory, Turing machines, and computational complexity.

name: Parallel and Distributed Computing
description: Understand how large-scale systems and cloud-based infrastructures process data concurrently.
